FacilityName: Wegmans Food Markets, Inc. Fresh Foods Facility

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This Risk Management Plan applies to the Wegmans Fresh Food Distribution Center refrigeration system.The facility is located  at 300 Market Street in Rochester, New York This RMPwas prepared in accordance with the Federal Clean Air Act (CAA) Section 112r and associated regulations and ammendments CFR Part 68. Thisfacility supplies refigerated fresh food to all Wegmans stores. This systems uses approximately 12,500 pounds of anhydrous ammonia as a refrigerant.

Accidental Release Prevention

The refrigeration system for Wegmans Fresh Food Distribution Center is regulated by the OSHA standard for process safety management (29CFR 1910.119). Wegmans meets the requirements for PSM at this facility and has applied this program as the Program 3 Prevention program for this RMP.

In addition to the PSM requirements, refrigeration system operators conduct daily walkdowns to assess system condition and operation. Items requiring attentionare acted upon immediately. Less serious conditions are logged and remedied in a timely manner. Preventive maintenance is conducted based upon manufacturer's recommendations and using manufacturer's parts and instructions.

Emergency Response

The Fresh Food Distribution Center refrigeration system is monitored by ammonia sensors that are wired directly to Wegmans Corporate Security Control Center and the Gates Fire Department. In the event of an ammonia release emergency, site security will contact the Gates Fire Department and request they respond. If necessary, the Gates Fire Department will ask the Monroe County HAZMAT team to also respond.

The facility has written emergency procedures. Several members of Wegmans emergency response team are trained in the use of personal protective equipment and will assist the Gates Fire Department in accident mitigation and response. The Gates Fire Department has trained with Wegmans personnel at the facility. Training is conducted annually with the next training session scheduled in May, 2004.

Five Ye

ar Accident History

There have been no releases or near misses during the last five years. There have been no releases in the life of the facility.

Plans to improve safety.

The Gates Fire Department will train at the facility with Wegmans personnel in May, 2004.
